segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā nāgadatto kosalesu viharati aññatarasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe.
segments.en: At one time Venerable Nāgadatta was staying in the land of the Kosalans in a certain forest grove.

segments.pli: Tena kho pana samayena āyasmā nāgadatto atikālena gāmaṃ pavisati, atidivā paṭikkamati.
segments.en: Now at that time Venerable Nāgadatta had been entering the village too early and returning late in the day.

segments.pli: Atha kho yā tasmiṃ vanasaṇḍe adhivatthā devatā āyasmato nāgadattassa anukampikā atthakāmā āyasmantaṃ nāgadattaṃ saṃvejetukāmā yenāyasmā nāgadatto tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ nāgadattaṃ gāthāhi ajjhabhāsi:
segments.en: Then the deity haunting that forest had compassion for Nāgadatta, wanting what’s best for him. So they approached him wanting to stir him up, and recited these verses:
and returning after spending too much of the day,
I’m afraid for Nāgadatta; he’s so reckless
May he not come under the King of Death’s power,
under the sway of the terminator!”

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā nāgadatto tāya devatāya saṃvejito saṃvegamāpādīti.
segments.en: Impelled by that deity, Venerable Nāgadatta was struck with a sense of urgency.
